articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israeli tank fire hit three towns along Lebanon's southeast border with Israel on Thursday, Lebanese security sources and state media said, a day after a ceasefire barring "offensive military operations" came into force.
articles.title: Israeli tank fires at 3 south Lebanese towns, Lebanese security sources, media say

articles.author: Anastasiia Malenko, Olena Harmash, Max Hunder
articles.description: Russia unleashed its second big attack on Ukraine's energy infrastructure this month on Thursday, triggering deep power cuts across the country.
articles.title: Russia hits Ukrainian energy facilities, Kyiv sees 'despicable escalation'

articles.author: Greg Torode, Karen Lema
articles.description: Online ship trackers show that many of the vessels in the satellite photos are Chinese-registered fishing craft.
articles.title: Exclusive: Chinese ships gather near island disputed with Philippines, satellite images show

articles.author: Francois Murphy
articles.description: Iran has informed the U.N. nuclear watchdog of plans to install more uranium-enriching centrifuges at its Fordow and Natanz plants as well as bring machines recently installed there online, a confidential report by the watchdog said on Thursday.
articles.title: Iran plans uranium-enrichment expansion at Natanz, Fordow, IAEA report says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: President Vladimir Putin said on Thursday that Russia would use all weapons at its disposal against Ukraine if Kyiv were to acquire nuclear arms.
articles.title: Putin says Russia would use all weapons at its disposal if Ukraine got nuclear weapons

articles.author: Sarah Morland, Ana Martinez
articles.description: Mexico's President Claudia Sheinbaum said on Thursday she and U.S. President-elect Donald Trump had agreed to maintain a good relationship in a friendly phone call that appeared to ease tensions between the top trading partners amid tariff threats.
articles.title: Mexico president touts friendly Trump call, looks to ease tariff tensions

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli forces stepped up bombardments on central areas and pushed tanks deeper in the north and south of the enclave.
articles.title: Israel ups bombing in central Gaza, strikes kill 17 people

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Venezuela's ruling-party dominated National Assembly on Thursday unanimously voted to approve a law which could see bans of up to 60 years on those seeking public office, who have expressed or allegedly expressed support for the imposition of sanctions on the South American country.
articles.title: Venezuela lawmakers back ban of up to 60 years on those supporting sanctions

articles.author: Luiza Ilie
articles.description: Romania's top court on Thursday ordered a recount of votes in the first round of the presidential election and the country's top security body warned Romania was a key target for hostile actions from Russia after a shock result in the ballot.
articles.title: Romania's top court orders presidential election recount

articles.author: Alasdair Pal
articles.description: Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese said on Friday that social media platforms now have a responsibility to ensure the safety of children, after the country's parliament passed a bill banning those under the age of 16 from using the services.
articles.title: Australia PM says social media firms now have a responsibility to protect kids
